Meaning: The part of the body above the neck where the brain, eyes, ears, nose, and mouth are.
ExampleSentence: I have a pain in my head.

Meaning: Each of the two upper limbs of the human body from the shoulder to the hand.
ExampleSentence: He broke his arm playing football.

Meaning: Each of the limbs on which a person or animal walks and stands.
ExampleSentence: My legs feel tired after the long walk.

Meaning: The lower extremity of the leg below the ankle, on which a person stands or walks.
ExampleSentence: I hurt my foot when I was running.

Meaning: The end part of a person's arm beyond the wrist, including the palm, fingers, and thumb.
ExampleSentence: Please wash your hands before dinner.

Meaning: Each of a pair of globular organs in the head through which people and vertebrate animals see.
ExampleSentence: She has beautiful blue eyes.

Meaning: A person who is qualified to treat people who are ill.
ExampleSentence: You should see a doctor if you feel unwell.

Meaning: A person trained to care for the sick or infirm, especially in a hospital.
ExampleSentence: The nurse gave him his medication.

Meaning: Affected by physical or mental illness.
ExampleSentence: He was sick with the flu.

Meaning: In a good physical or mental condition; in good health.
ExampleSentence: Eating vegetables is very healthy.

Meaning: Put (food) into the mouth and chew and swallow it.
ExampleSentence: It's important to eat a balanced diet.

Meaning: To rest your mind and body by closing your eyes and becoming unconscious.
ExampleSentence: You need to sleep for at least eight hours a night.

Meaning: A highly unpleasant physical sensation caused by illness or injury.
ExampleSentence: I have a sharp pain in my back.

Meaning: An abnormally high body temperature, usually accompanied by shivering and a headache.
ExampleSentence: The child has a high fever.

Meaning: The internal organ in which the major part of the digestion of food occurs.
ExampleSentence: My stomach hurts after eating that spicy food.

Meaning: The muscular organ in humans and other animals that pumps blood through the circulatory system.
ExampleSentence: Exercise is good for your heart.

Meaning: The red liquid that circulates in the arteries and veins of humans and other vertebrate animals.
ExampleSentence: He lost a lot of blood in the accident.

Meaning: Any of the pieces of hard, whitish tissue making up the skeleton in humans and other vertebrates.
ExampleSentence: Calcium helps to build strong bones.

Meaning: The thin layer of tissue forming the natural outer covering of the body of a person or animal.
ExampleSentence: It's important to protect your skin from the sun.

Meaning: A band or bundle of fibrous tissue in a human or animal body that has the ability to contract, producing movement.
ExampleSentence: He pulled a muscle in his leg while running.

Meaning: An organ of soft nervous tissue contained in the skull of vertebrates, functioning as the coordinating center of the body.
ExampleSentence: The brain controls all the functions of the body.

Meaning: Move at a speed faster than a walk, never having both or all the feet on the ground at the same time.
ExampleSentence: I like to run in the park every morning.

Meaning: Move at a regular pace by lifting and setting down each foot in turn, never having both feet off the ground at once.
ExampleSentence: Walking is a gentle form of exercise.

Meaning: Take (a liquid) into the mouth and swallow.
ExampleSentence: You should drink plenty of water every day.

Meaning: Clean with water and, typically, soap or detergent.
ExampleSentence: Remember to wash your hands to prevent germs from spreading.

Meaning: A hard, calcified structure in the jaws of most vertebrates, used for biting and chewing.
ExampleSentence: I need to see a dentist about this painful tooth.

Meaning: A continuous or prolonged dull pain in a part of one's body.
ExampleSentence: I have a dull ache in my shoulder.

Meaning: A small round mass of solid medicine for swallowing whole.
ExampleSentence: The doctor told me to take one pill every morning.

Meaning: Cease work or movement in order to relax, refresh oneself, or recover strength.
ExampleSentence: You look tired, you should get some rest.

Meaning: A common viral infection of the nose and throat.
ExampleSentence: I think I'm catching a cold.

Meaning: The rear surface of the human body from the shoulders to the hips.
ExampleSentence: He injured his back lifting heavy boxes.

Meaning: The part of the face that contains the nostrils and the organs of smell and is used for breathing.
ExampleSentence: He has a runny nose because of his cold.

Meaning: The opening in the lower part of the human face, surrounded by the lips, through which food is taken in.
ExampleSentence: Don't speak with your mouth full.

Meaning: The pair of organs situated within the rib cage, consisting of elastic sacs with branching passages into which air is drawn.
ExampleSentence: Smoking is very damaging to the lungs.

Meaning: Each of a pair of organs in the abdominal cavity of mammals, birds, and reptiles, that excrete urine.
ExampleSentence: Drinking enough water is essential for kidney function.

Meaning: A large lobed glandular organ in the abdomen of vertebrates, involved in many metabolic processes.
ExampleSentence: The liver plays a vital role in detoxifying the body.

Meaning: Break down (food) in the alimentary canal into substances that can be absorbed and used by the body.
ExampleSentence: It takes several hours for the stomach to digest a large meal.

Meaning: Take air into the lungs and then expel it, as a regular physiological process.
ExampleSentence: It's refreshing to breathe the clean mountain air.

Meaning: Activity requiring physical effort, carried out to sustain or improve health and fitness.
ExampleSentence: Regular exercise can reduce the risk of heart disease.

Meaning: The process of providing or obtaining the food necessary for health and growth.
ExampleSentence: Good nutrition is crucial for a child's development.

Meaning: A group of organic compounds which are essential for normal growth and nutrition and are required in small quantities in the diet.
ExampleSentence: Oranges are a good source of Vitamin C.

Meaning: A unit of energy, often used as a measurement of the amount of energy that food provides.
ExampleSentence: This meal contains about 500 calories.

Meaning: A physical or mental feature which is regarded as indicating a condition of disease.
ExampleSentence: A sore throat is a common symptom of a cold.

Meaning: The identification of the nature of an illness or other problem by examination of the symptoms.
ExampleSentence: The doctor's diagnosis was that she had the flu.

Meaning: Medical care given to a patient for an illness or injury.
ExampleSentence: He is receiving treatment for a knee injury.

Meaning: An instruction written by a medical practitioner that authorizes a patient to be provided a medicine or treatment.
ExampleSentence: You can take this prescription to any pharmacy.

Meaning: A substance used to stimulate the production of antibodies and provide immunity against one or several diseases.
ExampleSentence: The measles vaccine is highly effective.

Meaning: A damaging immune response by the body to a substance, especially pollen, fur, a particular food, or dust.
ExampleSentence: She has a severe allergy to peanuts.

Meaning: A localized physical condition in which part of the body becomes reddened, swollen, hot, and often painful.
ExampleSentence: The medicine helps to reduce inflammation.

Meaning: (Of an illness) persisting for a long time or constantly recurring.
ExampleSentence: He suffers from chronic back pain.

Meaning: (Of a bad, difficult, or unwelcome situation or illness) present or experienced to a severe or intense degree; short-lived.
ExampleSentence: He was hospitalized with an acute infection.

Meaning: An instance of being injured; harm or damage.
ExampleSentence: She sustained a serious injury in the car crash.

Meaning: The cracking or breaking of a hard object or material, especially a bone.
ExampleSentence: The X-ray showed a small fracture in his wrist.

Meaning: The process of infecting or the state of being infected.
ExampleSentence: You should clean the wound to prevent infection.

Meaning: An infective agent that typically consists of a nucleic acid molecule in a protein coat and is too small to be seen by light microscopy.
ExampleSentence: The common cold is caused by a virus.

Meaning: A large group of unicellular microorganisms which have cell walls but lack organelles and an organized nucleus.
ExampleSentence: Some bacteria are harmful, but many are beneficial.

Meaning: A medicine that inhibits the growth of or destroys microorganisms.
ExampleSentence: The doctor prescribed an antibiotic for the bacterial infection.

Meaning: The chemical processes that occur within a living organism in order to maintain life.
ExampleSentence: Exercise can help to boost your metabolism.

Meaning: The organs and processes of the body that provide resistance to infection and toxins.
ExampleSentence: A healthy diet helps to support your immune system.

Meaning: The position in which someone holds their body when standing or sitting.
ExampleSentence: Sitting at a desk all day can lead to poor posture.

Meaning: The process of causing something to absorb water; being adequately hydrated.
ExampleSentence: Proper hydration is important, especially when exercising.

Meaning: A person qualified to practice medicine; a doctor.
ExampleSentence: A general physician can refer you to a specialist.

Meaning: Treatment intended to relieve or heal a disorder.
ExampleSentence: He is undergoing physical therapy for his injured knee.

Meaning: A feeling of worry, nervousness, or unease, typically about an imminent event or something with an uncertain outcome.
ExampleSentence: Many people suffer from anxiety in stressful situations.

Meaning: A mental health disorder characterized by persistently depressed mood or loss of interest in activities, causing significant impairment in daily life.
ExampleSentence: It is important to seek help for depression.

Meaning: A structure in the human or animal body at which two parts of the skeleton are fitted together.
ExampleSentence: The knee is the largest joint in the body.

Meaning: Relating to the heart and blood vessels.
ExampleSentence: Regular aerobic exercise improves cardiovascular health.

Meaning: Relating to or affecting respiration or the organs of respiration.
ExampleSentence: Asthma is a chronic respiratory disease.

Meaning: Relating to the anatomy, functions, and organic disorders of nerves and the nervous system.
ExampleSentence: The patient underwent a series of neurological tests.

Meaning: Relating to glands which secrete hormones or other products directly into the blood.
ExampleSentence: The endocrine system regulates hormones in the body.

Meaning: The likely course of a medical condition.
ExampleSentence: The doctor gave him a positive prognosis for recovery.

Meaning: Characterized by the treatment of the whole person, taking into account mental and social factors, rather than just the symptoms of a disease.
ExampleSentence: Holistic medicine considers the mind, body, and spirit.

Meaning: The treatment of disease, injury, or deformity by physical methods such as massage, heat treatment, and exercise.
ExampleSentence: She is having physiotherapy to regain movement in her arm.

Meaning: The branch of medicine concerned with the uses, effects, and modes of action of drugs.
ExampleSentence: He is studying pharmacology at university.

Meaning: The branch of medicine which deals with the incidence, distribution, and possible control of diseases.
ExampleSentence: Epidemiology helps us understand how diseases spread.

Meaning: A bacterium, virus, or other microorganism that can cause disease.
ExampleSentence: The laboratory is working to identify the pathogen.

Meaning: (Of a condition or a person) producing or showing no symptoms.
ExampleSentence: Many infections can be asymptomatic, making them hard to detect.

Meaning: The simultaneous presence of two or more diseases or medical conditions in a patient.
ExampleSentence: Diabetes often has a high comorbidity with heart disease.

Meaning: Situated or applied under the skin.
ExampleSentence: Insulin is typically administered as a subcutaneous injection.

Meaning: Existing or taking place within, or administered into, a vein or veins.
ExampleSentence: The patient received fluids through an intravenous drip.

Meaning: (Of a disease or physical abnormality) present from birth.
ExampleSentence: He was diagnosed with a congenital heart defect.

Meaning: (Of a treatment) relieving pain or alleviating a problem without dealing with the underlying cause.
ExampleSentence: Palliative care focuses on improving the quality of life for patients.

Meaning: A substance capable of causing cancer in living tissue.
ExampleSentence: Tobacco smoke contains several known carcinogens.

Meaning: An examination of tissue removed from a living body to discover the presence, cause, or extent of a disease.
ExampleSentence: A biopsy confirmed the presence of cancerous cells.

Meaning: The study and treatment of tumors.
ExampleSentence: She works in the oncology department of the hospital.

Meaning: The study of the physiology of the blood.
ExampleSentence: Hematology is the branch of medicine concerned with blood disorders.

Meaning: The branch of medicine or social science dealing with the health and care of old people.
ExampleSentence: Geriatrics focuses on the unique health needs of the elderly.

Meaning: The branch of medicine dealing with children and their diseases.
ExampleSentence: He is a specialist in pediatrics.

Meaning: The branch of medicine dealing with the correction of deformities of bones or muscles.
ExampleSentence: The orthopedics department treats bone and joint injuries.

Meaning: Insensibility to pain, especially as artificially induced by the administration of gases or the injection of drugs before surgical operations.
ExampleSentence: The patient was put under general anesthesia before the surgery.

Meaning: (Of a disease) spread from one person or organism to another by direct or indirect contact.
ExampleSentence: Chickenpox is a highly contagious disease.

Meaning: Determined by genetic factors and therefore able to be passed on from parents to their offspring.
ExampleSentence: Some forms of baldness are hereditary.

Meaning: A general feeling of discomfort, illness, or uneasiness whose exact cause is difficult to identify.
ExampleSentence: She complained of a general malaise and fatigue.

Meaning: A harmless pill, medicine, or procedure prescribed more for the psychological benefit to the patient than for any physiological effect.
ExampleSentence: In the clinical trial, one group received the drug and the other received a placebo.

Meaning: A stitch or row of stitches holding together the edges of a wound or surgical incision.
ExampleSentence: The doctor used a fine thread to make the suture.

Meaning: A group of symptoms which consistently occur together, or a condition characterized by a set of associated symptoms.
ExampleSentence: Chronic fatigue syndrome can be difficult to diagnose.

Meaning: The process of determining the priority of patients' treatments based on the severity of their condition.
ExampleSentence: Nurses in the emergency room are responsible for triage.

Meaning: The administration of a vaccine to help the immune system develop protection from a disease.
ExampleSentence: Childhood vaccination is essential for public health.

Meaning: Relating to or denoting a disease caused by a microorganism that produces fermentation, such as a fever.
ExampleSentence: Cholera is considered a zymotic disease.

Meaning: An illness, typically a minor one.
ExampleSentence: He suffered from a variety of minor ailments in his old age.
